communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Yondr Pouches
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.)All purchase orders, invoices, contracts, and agreements related to the acquisition of Yondr pouches or similar cell phone storage devices for use in Fairfax County Public Schools, particularly for the pilot program starting in the 2024-2025 school year at Frost, Irving, Jackson, Poe, Robinson, Thoreau, and Twain Middle Schools.

2.) Any policies, regulations, or guidelines developed by Fairfax County Public Schools regarding the implementation and use of Yondr pouches or similar cell phone storage devices in schools.

3.) Any studies, reports, or analyses conducted or commissioned by Fairfax County Public Schools regarding the impact of cell phone use on student learning, engagement, or achievement, which were used to inform the decision to implement the Yondr pouch pilot program.

4.) Minutes or records of any school board meetings or administrative meetings where the Yondr pouch pilot program was discussed and approved.
Any communication between Fairfax County Public Schools officials and Yondr company representatives regarding the implementation of this program.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and will contribute significantly to the public's understanding of the use of public funds and the implementation of new educational policies in our school system.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Gabriel Garcia.

title: Photos from ATF collaboration with Tony Scott film "Deja Vu" (2006)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Photos from ATF collaboration with Tony Scott film "Deja Vu" (2006)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

High-resolution, color copies--preferably transferred to me digitally, if not then by mail--of the 26 photos released to me by ATF in response to request 2023-01687 (in which I asked for documents relating to ATF collaboration with the 2006 Tony Scott film "Deja Vu"), along with equally high-quality copies of any other photos taken on the set of that film and in the possession of the ATF that were not released to me earlier. The photos I received from ATF are black-and-white scans and of relatively poor visual quality. I therefore request high-resolution, color copies of the same photos, plus any others associated with "Deja Vu" that were not released from the earlier request. 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

files.title: PA Right to Know Request  Form

communications.subject: Mayor's Office - Philly Mayor Fair Workweek comments
communications.communication:
THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA      Re: Mayor's Office - Philly Mayor Fair Workweek comments    Your receipt number is: 28977  Dear 170869-56579309@requests. muckrock. com, 
   
 Thank you for your correspondence.  This is an automatic email confirming that your correspondence has been entered into our case management system for processing and response. If you have an additional request you wish to file, or if you wish to make a change to a pending request, please email it directly to righttoknowlaw@.phila.gov.     Did you know that the City already releases a lot of information and open data online?  You might be able to find the answer to your inquiry right now!   
   
 
Here are some common types of requests we receive and where to find this information online right now:  
 
 Search for a property's L&I related permits, licenses, violations, and appeals with the L&I property history tool.  
 
 Search for a property's Real Estate Tax Balance with the Revenue Department's tax real estate lookup tool.  
 
 Find all of the City of Philadelphia's open data sets, including City employee salary data, on Open Data Philly, the Philadelphia region's open data portal.  
 
 Search information about professional service contracts online at eContract Philly.  
 
 Search information about procurement contracts online with PHL Contracts.  
 
 Search City legislation and related hearings online with Legistar.  
 
 Obtain financial disclosure forms from the Department of Records.  
 
 
   If you seek a police incident report, you can obtain the proper form from the Department of Records.  Please note that police incident reports cost $25.      If you seek audio, visual, or bodycam records from the Philadelphia Police Department, you will need to make a request following the instructions in 42 Pa.C.S.A. Sec. 67A03 at https://www.legis.state.pa.us/cfdocs/legis/LI/consCheck.cfm?txtType=HTM&ttl=42&div=0&chpt=67A. Such requests must be made in-person or via 
certified mail following the instructions in 42 Pa.C.S.A. §  67A(3) (aka
 Act 22). Such requests are not processed under the RTKL. See 42 Pa.C.S.A. § 67A(2)(a); 65 P.S. §§ 67.305, 67.3101.1. You may use this form to make a request under Act 22. Requests under Act 22  should be addressed to: Lieutenant Barry Jacobs, Philadelphia Police Department, Open Records/Right to Know Section, Philadelphia Public Services Building, 400 N. Broad St., 4W-72, Philadelphia, PA 19130. Such requests are not processed under the Right-to-Know Law.       Use the forms on this page to request copies of various public safety from the Department of Records, such as:   
 Traffic Accident Reports (aka "crash report" - also available through https://public-safety-reports.phila.gov/)  A records check or letter of good conduct from the Philadelphia Police Department  Fire Reports  Emergency Medical Services Reports       The City of Philadelphia does not process Right-to-Know requests for the organizations listed below.  If you want to submit a request to one of these entities, please click the links below to be directed to their Open Records Policies:   
 
Philadelphia Parking Authority  
 
 
School District of Philadelphia  
 
 
City of Philadelphia District Attorney’s Office  
 
 
Philadelphia Redevelopment Authority  
 
 
First Judicial District (Philadelphia Court of Common Pleas)  
 
 
   If one of these sources has solved your inquiry, please let us know!  Otherwise, thank you for your patience, and we will be in touch soon.   Sincerely,   The City of Philadelphia  Please Note: To help make sure that future emails from us don't end up in your spam or junk folder, please add this email address to your safe sender list.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Select Secure Scheduling Council Emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all emails and attachments identified in the attached file ("2024-08-01_C169558_Fugiel-LEG_Seattle-Council-select-metadata.csv"). Note that this file contains a subset of metadata for 986 emails (of which 232 have attachments) selected from a much larger set of emails sent or received by Council Members or staff with reference to the Secure Scheduling Ordinance. I obtained these metadata in response to a preliminary request (#C169558-020124) which I used to identify the most relevant records for my research. I modified the original metadata file ("20240320_C169558_Fugiel_metadata_LEG.csv") by adding an index for the row number, removing empty or uninformative columns, classifying the period when the email was sent (Y1 = 2016, Y2 = 2017), and flagging selected emails (Selected = TRUE). I believe that the modified file contains sufficient information to retrieve the selected emails and attachments. Please let me know if you encounter any difficulty using this file or would prefer for me to merge the selection flag into the full metadata file.

I am requesting these records for non-commercial research purposes. The records will be made available to the general public. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Internal mail theft in Detroit
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Heberg:

This acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the U.S. Postal Service Office of Inspector General (OIG) for records related to complaints of internal mail theft in Detroit, Michigan between April 1, 2022, and August 1, 2024.

However, we are unable to conduct a search for responsive records without all applicable ZIP codes you wish us to search against.

Once this information is received, we will create a FOIA request and begin searching for responsive records.

Due to the large volume of investigations conducted by the USPS OIG, it is the standard practice of this office to provide a spreadsheet of all investigative work which falls within the parameters of the request. This allows us to provide releasable information in a timely manner. Otherwise, the only way to establish whether an investigation is responsive to a specific request is to review each file individually.

Sincerely,

USPS OIG FOIA Team

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: City contracts/agreements with fiscal intermediaries
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all contracts and/or grant agreements between City of Detroit departments or budgeted units, and fiscal sponsors (which are sometimes also referred to as fiscal intermediaries or nonprofit fiduciaries) since 2018.  

For context, Office of Chief Financial Officer Communications Manager Stephanie Davis said a nonprofit fiduciary is a philanthropic group city departments use to send funds for a particular initiative or purpose. Those funds are tied to a grant agreement outlining the duration, terms, etc. of the work. 

For example, the Mayor's Office-Mobility uses Eastside Community Network as a fiscal sponsor.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Laura Herberg

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: City contracts/agreements with fiscal intermediaries
communications.communication:
This email serves as the City of Detroit’s response to the above-referenced matter. Your request was received at the City of Detroit Law Department Freedom of Information Act Section via facsimile or email, on August 1, 2024. Because your request was received by electronic transmission, pursuant to Section 5(1) of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (the “Act”), MCL 15.235(1); it is deemed to have been received at the Law Department on the next business day, August 2, 2024.

Pursuant to Section 5(2) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2), the City’s response is due within five (5) business days. However, due to the nature and the scope of your request and the volume of the requests received by the City, we are extending the City’s response deadline by ten (10) additional business days in accordance with Section 5(2) (d) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2) (d). Therefore, your request will be granted, denied, or granted in part and denied in part on or before August 23, 2024.

Your request is being handled by Amanda Kelly. If you have questions regarding your request, or if you did not provide an email address in your request, please forward it to Amanda Kelly at kellya@detroitmi.gov<mailto:kellya@detroitmi.gov> to provide you a response more readily than by regular mail or fax. Mail and fax are not preferred at this time since they both require in-office support. We thank you in advance for your understanding.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Dispatcher ID numbers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:
Please furnish the following information: the employee ID numbers and names of the employees working in the north com (PBG) dispatch center 7/31/24 through 8/1/24

A specific employee intensified herself as "Jessica" around 4:00am but according to my internal records source there was not a "Jessica" on call nor on the clock and she did not give her ID number per department policy. I made several calls to the dispatch center which were subsequently hung up on and no additional information was gathered.

Please furnish the individuals working in the dispatch center during this period and the ID Numbers so a proper internal affairs investigation can proceed. Please Contact the city attorney regarding this matter as falsified information will lead to a civil complaint.

Respectfully,
Mason C. Turner

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Maurice Stans
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Maurice Hubert Stans (March 22, 1908 - April 14, 1998). Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Bernard B. Fall
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry of Bernard B. Fall (November 19, 1926 - February 21, 1967). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/1967/02/22/archives/bernard-fall-killed-in-vietnam-by-a-mine-while-with-marines-bernard.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. Paul Galante

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Toolmex Corporation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into the Toolmex  Corporation. Toolmex was a suspected commercial cover operation for Polish intelligence activities in the United States. Previously disclosed records circa 1985 indicated the leadership of  Toolmex were suspected intelligence officers and Marian W. Zacharski was convicted of spying on behalf Polish intelligence while working at the Polish-American Machine Company (POLAMCO), a predecessor to Toolmex (source: https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP87M00539R000901190016-2.pdf, p. 17)

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: Plan First (Michigan Department of Health and Human Services)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Plan First (Michigan Department of Health and Human Services)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting copies of records documenting requests for changes or enhancements related to the Medicaid Plan First category within Michigan’s integrated eligibility system, as referenced under contract no. 071B7700072, and copies of the associated cost estimates produced by Deloitte to implement these changes. Specifically, I am seeking records that were submitted to or reviewed by:

-DTMB Procurement officials responsible for contract amendments and approvals.
-The DTMB Project Manager(s) overseeing the Bridges eligibility system.

This request should include records for changes that were either in pending status, submitted, or processed between June 30, 2023 and the date of production of this records request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samantha Liss

communications.subject: Confirmation of FOIA Request:: H025036-080124
communications.communication:
Dear Mrs. Liss, 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services (hereinafter “Department”). 
 Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

I am requesting copies of records documenting requests for changes or enhancements related to the Medicaid Plan First category within Michigan’s integrated eligibility system, as referenced under contract no. 071B7700072, and copies of the associated cost estimates produced by Deloitte to implement these changes. Specifically, I am seeking records that were submitted to or reviewed by: 

-DTMB Procurement officials responsible for contract amendments and approvals. 
-The DTMB Project Manager(s) overseeing the Bridges eligibility system. 

This request should include records for changes that were either in pending status, submitted, or processed between June 30, 2023 and the date of production of this records request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Samantha Liss

communications.subject: Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Hawaii LIHTC QCs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all requests or applications for qualified contracts for LIHTC developments submitted to the Hawaii Housing Finance & Development Corporation, including the following:

1) The year of the application or request
2) The projects's name, full address, and ownership
3) The qualified contract price
4) The total number of units covered
5) The outcome of the request and start and end dates of the deregulation period, if one ensued
6) Any information retained by the agency on the requester or applicant, including their name, contact information, and organizational affiliation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Burns

communications.subject: RE: PIR - 8482 Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas LIHTC QCs
communications.communication:
Hello,

The Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs acknowledges receipt of your Public Information Request (PIR - 8482). Please note that TDHCA is only required to provide documentation that is readily available, it is not required to create documentation to fulfill a public information request.

Barring any need for clarification or additional time to produce the requested information, we will produce your requested information as soon as possible. Furthermore, we will notify you and provide an estimate if any charges apply to your request.

Your media contact moving forward for this PIR will be Kristina Tirloni.

Thank you.

Open Records Office
Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs
221 E. 11th Street | Austin, TX 78701
Fax: 512.469.9606

About TDHCA
The Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs administers a number of state and federal programs through for-profit, nonprofit, and local government partnerships to strengthen communities through affordable housing development, homeownership opportunities, weatherization, and community-based services for Texans in need. For more information, including current funding opportunities and information on local providers, please visit https://www.tdhca.texas.gov/. For more information about filing a Public Information Request (PIR) and the guidelines of the Texas Public Information Act (PIA), please visit https://www.tdhca.texas.gov/public-information-act.

Any person receiving guidance from TDHCA staff should be mindful that, as set forth in 10 TAC Section 11.1(b), there are important limitations and caveats (Also see 10 TAC §10.2(b)).

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

title: Orleans Parish Prison Emergency Evacuation Plan (New Orleans Police Department)

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Orleans Parish Prison Emergency Evacuation Plan (New Orleans Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting documents surrounding the Orleans Parish Prison's emergency evacuation plan. My request applies to records maintained by or within the possession, custody or control of Orleans Parish, including, but not limited to, the Orleans Parish Sheriff's Department and the New Orleans Police Department as well as any authorized sub-entity, agent, vendor or contractor. All guides, manuals, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and other written policies, procedures or directives related to emergency evacuations of the people incarcerated in the jail in the event of fire, flooding, disease, or any other disaster, including all interim, draft or superseded versions, are included in this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Riley

communications.subject: Your City of New Orleans public records request #24-12941 has been opened.
communications.communication:
City of New Orleans ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-12941 has been submitted successfully. Thank you, the City of New Orleans Law Department has received your Public Records Law request. Your request has been forwarded to the City department or office which is the custodian of the records you requested. The custodian will determine whether responsive records exist, and if so, compile the records for your review. Please refer to the due date located on the individual "Request #" page for an estimate of when your records, if any, will be available. This estimated due date may be adjusted depending on the nature of your request. Note also that records may be in active use at this time and therefore not available for immediate review. Additionally, in accordance with the Louisiana Public Records Law, the City of New Orleans strives to promptly release all records which contain only public information and are not otherwise exempt from the Public Records Law. The City must balance its commitment to open access with its legal obligation to review public records for such exceptions and exemptions prior to release. Also, please note that there may be a delay in responding to requests for email. Requests for email must first be sent to the City's IT Department to retrieve the requested emails. The emails must then be examined to determine if there is any material that must be redacted for privacy concerns and otherwise. As soon as the custodian notifies our office that the records have been compiled you will be invoiced by email. Once you pay the invoice, you may download the records. Alternatively, you may schedule a time to review or purchase copies of the records. Thank you for your request, and we look forward to working with you to provide public records in a fair and efficient manner. Thank you, City of New Orleans ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of New Orleans.

communications.subject: Your City and County of San Francisco public records request #24-4579 has been closed.
communications.communication:
City and County of San Francisco ************************************************************************ Record request #24-4579 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: Dear Requestor, Thank you for contacting the San Francisco Controller’s Office. The Controller serves as the chief accounting officer and auditor for the City and County of San Francisco. The Controller's Office is responsible for governance and conduct of key aspects of the City's financial operations, including operating the City's financial systems and issuing its financial procedures, maintaining the City's internal control environment, processing payroll for City employees, managing the City's bonds and debt portfolio, and processing and monitoring the City's budget. The department audits and produces regular reports on the City's financial and economic condition and the operations and performance of City government. We are not the stewards of communications for Non-Controller's Office employees. We have finished conducting a diligent search and found no documents responsive to your request. Therefore, we consider your request closed. Please also find links below to online tools including SFOpenBook, DataSF and SFController Reports, where the Public has 24/7 access to City budget, financial, supplier and operating data.      * SFOpenBook - https://openbook.sfgov.org * DataSF - https://datasf.org * SFController - Reports Search * CCSF’s Public Records Requests - https://sanfrancisco.nextrequest.com * CCSF Index to Records - https://index.sfgov.org * CCSF Board of Supervisors Legislation & Related Reporting - https://sfgov.legistar.com/Legislation.aspx * San Francisco Sales Tax Map - http://sfstax.hdlgov.com/geodata/ This concludes your public records request. Sincerely, Office of the Controller ************************************************************************ Questions about your request?
